page.title: 08WATLING ESTATE,BURNT OAK.
page.content: The Watling Estate was built as one of the largest council estates in the country. The houses are 'cottage' type, built in a variety of styles and materials, predominantly 'redbrick', but with some timber-fronted and some metal-plated. Many people have now bought their homes from the council and have made alterations to them. {Watling Market:}Burnt Oak's market is an old established one, granted by royal charter. In the early days of the Estate the main shopping street, Watling Avenue, was crammed with market barrows. The majority are now off-street, in Watling Market, behind Watling Avenue. The future of Watling market is uncertain. There is speculation that, as part of a plan to develop Burnt Oak shopping centre, the council want to move the market further away from Watling Avenue.
